name: Acid Splash
components: V, S
description: You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage. This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

name: Cure Wounds
components: V, S
description: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Magic Missile
components: V, S
description: You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several. At Higher Levels, you create one more dart for each slot above 1st.

name: Shield
components: V, S
description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

name: Fireball
components: V, S, M (a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur)
description: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot above 3rd.

name: Guidance
components: V, S
description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice.

name: Banishment
components: V, S, M (an item distasteful to the target)
description: You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished.

name: Mage Armor
components: V, S, M (a piece of cured leather)
description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target’s base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss it as an action.

name: Bless
components: V, S, M (a sprinkling of holy water)
description: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw. At Higher Levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot above 1st.

name: Fire Bolt
components: V, S
description: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack; on a hit, the target takes fire damage. The damage scales with level.

name: Ray of Frost
components: V, S
description: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range; on a hit, it takes cold damage and its speed is reduced until your next turn.

name: Shocking Grasp
components: V, S
description: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a jolt. Make a melee spell attack; on a hit, lightning damage and the target can’t take reactions until its next turn.

name: Light
components: V, M (a firefly or phosphorescent moss)
description: You touch an object to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

name: Mage Hand
components: V, S
description: A spectral hand appears at a point you choose within range. It can manipulate objects, open doors, stow or retrieve items.

name: Minor Illusion
components: S, M (a bit of fleece)
description: Create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration; examination reveals the illusion.

name: Thaumaturgy
components: V
description: Manifest a minor wonder: booming voice, flickering flames, harmless tremors, or similar effects.

name: Sacred Flame
components: V, S
description: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature; it must succeed on a Dexterity save or take radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this save.

name: Poison Spray
components: V, S
description: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see and project a puff of noxious gas. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take poison damage.

name: Prestidigitation
components: V, S
description: Perform minor magical tricks: clean, soil, chill, warm, flavor, light or snuff candles, and other simple effects.

name: Burning Hands
components: V, S
description: As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a thin sheet of flames shoots forth. Creatures in a 15-foot cone make a Dexterity save, taking fire damage on a fail or half on success. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Detect Magic
components: V, S
description: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet and can learn its school with an action.

name: Feather Fall
components: V, M (a small feather or down)
description: Choose up to five falling creatures; their rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends.

name: Thunderwave
components: V, S
description: A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you makes a Constitution save, taking thunder damage and possibly being pushed. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Invisibility
components: V, S, M (an eyelash encased in gum arabic)
description: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. The spell ends early if the target attacks or casts a spell. At Higher Levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Lightning Bolt
components: V, S, M (a bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass)
description: A stroke of lightning forming a line blasts out from you. Each creature in the line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking lightning damage on a fail or half on success. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Sleep
components: V, S, M (a pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket)
description: This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures the spell can affect, starting with the lowest current HP. No save; ends on damage or an action to shake awake. At Higher Levels: The amount of hit points affected increases by 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Charm Person
components: V, S
description: Attempt to charm a humanoid you can see. It must make a Wisdom save or be charmed by you until the spell ends or you harm it.

name: Disguise Self
components: V, S
description: You make yourself—including clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends.

name: Shield of Faith
components: V, S, M (a small parchment with a bit of holy text)
description: +2 bonus to AC for a creature of your choice within range for the duration.

name: Protection from Evil and Good
components: V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron)
description: Protects a willing creature against aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead: disadvantage to be charmed, frightened, or possessed; attacks have disadvantage.

name: Guiding Bolt
components: V, S
description: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice; on a hit, radiant damage and the next attack roll made against the target has advantage before the end of your next turn. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Entangle
components: V, S
description: Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range, restraining creatures on a failed Strength save.

name: Goodberry
components: V, S, M (a sprig of mistletoe)
description: Up to ten magical berries appear in your hand, infused with magic for nourishment and healing.

name: Grease
components: V, S, M (a bit of pork rind or butter)
description: Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point; the area becomes difficult terrain and creatures entering or starting there must save or fall prone.

name: Scorching Ray
components: V, S
description: You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range; make a ranged spell attack for each ray. At Higher Levels: You create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Web
components: V, S, M (a bit of spiderweb)
description: Thick, sticky webs fill a 20-foot cube; the area is difficult terrain and can restrain creatures that fail a Dexterity save.

name: Mirror Image
components: V, S
description: Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space, protecting you from attacks.

name: Misty Step
components: V
description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

name: Hold Person
components: V, S, M (a small piece of iron)
description: Choose a humanoid that you can see; it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At Higher Levels: You can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Levitate
components: V, S, M (either a small leather loop or a piece of golden wire bent into a cup shape)
description: One creature or object of your choice rises vertically, up to 20 feet, and remains suspended for the duration.

name: Darkness
components: V, M (bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal)
description: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose, creating a heavily obscured area that blocks darkvision.

name: Shatter
components: V, S, M (a chip of mica)
description: A sudden loud ringing noise painfully intense erupts; creatures in a 10-foot sphere must make a Constitution save, taking thunder damage on a fail or half on success. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Blur
components: V
description: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you; attackers have disadvantage.

name: Fly
components: V, S, M (a wing feather from any bird)
description: You touch a willing creature; it gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Counterspell
components: S
description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell; the spell fails if its level is equal to or less than the slot used.

name: Dispel Magic
components: V, S
description: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect; any spell of 3rd level or lower ends. For higher level spells, make an ability check.

name: Haste
components: V, S, M (a shaving of licorice root)
description: Choose a willing creature; its speed is doubled, gains +2 bonus to AC, advantage on Dexterity saves, and an additional action on each of its turns.

name: Chill Touch
components: V, S
description: A ghostly skeletal hand clings to a creature; on a hit, it deals necrotic damage and the target can't regain hit points until your next turn.

name: Mending
components: V, S, M (two lodestones)
description: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, no larger than 1 foot in any dimension.

name: Message
components: V, S, M (a short piece of copper wire)
description: You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message; only the target hears it and can reply in a whisper.

name: Resistance
components: V, S, M (a miniature cloak)
description: Touch one willing creature; once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the result to one saving throw of its choice.

name: Spare the Dying
components: V, S
description: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points; the creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

name: True Strike
components: S
description: You extend your hand and point a finger at a target; on your next turn, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against it.

name: Vicious Mockery
components: V
description: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments; on a failed Wisdom save, the target takes psychic damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll.

name: Druidcraft
components: V, S
description: Whisper to the spirits of nature: predict weather, create small sensory effects, or make small flowers bloom.

name: Produce Flame
components: V, S
description: A flickering flame appears in your hand; it sheds light, and you can hurl it to deal fire damage with a ranged spell attack.

name: Shillelagh
components: V, S, M (mistletoe, a shamrock leaf, and a club or quarterstaff)
description: The wood of a club or quarterstaff you are holding is imbued with nature's power; you can use your spellcasting ability for attack and damage rolls.

name: Bane
components: V, S, M (a drop of blood)
description: Up to three creatures of your choice make Charisma saves; on a fail, subtract 1d4 from attack rolls and saving throws while the spell lasts. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

name: Command
components: V
description: Speak a one-word command to a creature; on a failed Wisdom save, it follows the command on its next turn if it can.

name: Comprehend Languages
components: V, S, M (a pinch of soot and salt)
description: For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language you hear and any written language you see.

name: Sanctuary
components: V, S, M (a small silver mirror)
description: You ward a creature; creatures must make a Wisdom save to target it with an attack or harmful spell. The ward ends if the warded creature attacks or casts a spell that affects an enemy.

name: Aid
components: V, S, M (a tiny strip of white cloth)
description: Your spell bolsters your allies with toughness and resolve; three creatures' hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 5 for the duration. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, a target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by an additional 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Darkvision
components: V, S, M (either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate)
description: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see in darkness as if it were dim light out to 60 feet.

name: Enlarge/Reduce
components: V, S, M (a pinch of powdered iron)
description: You cause a creature or object to grow or shrink. Enlarge grants advantage on Strength checks and saves; Reduce imposes disadvantage and lowers damage.

name: Lesser Restoration
components: V, S
description: You touch a creature and can end one disease or one condition afflicting it, such as blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

name: Animate Dead
components: V, S, M (a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust)
description: This spell creates an undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range; it becomes a skeleton or zombie under your control. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional undead creatures for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Daylight
components: V, S
description: A 60-foot-radius sphere of bright light spreads from a point you choose. It dispels darkness of 3rd level or lower created by spells.

name: Remove Curse
components: V, S
description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the item can be removed.

name: Water Breathing
components: V, S, M (a short reed or piece of straw)
description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends.

name: Eldritch Blast
components: V, S
description: A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range; make a ranged spell attack for force damage. The number of beams increases at higher levels.

name: Healing Word
components: V
description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Identify
components: V, S, M (a pearl worth at least 100 gp and an owl feather)
description: You choose one object that you must touch; if it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them.

name: Faerie Fire
components: V
description: Each object in a 20-foot cube is outlined in light; affected creatures shed dim light and attacks against them have advantage if the attacker can see them.

name: Alarm
components: V, S, M (a tiny bell and a piece of fine silver wire)
description: You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion; choose a door, a window, or an area within range.

name: Create or Destroy Water
components: V, S, M (a drop of water if creating water or a few grains of sand if destroying it)
description: Create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in open containers, or destroy up to 10 gallons of water.

name: Detect Poison and Disease
components: V, S, M (a yew leaf)
description: For the duration, you can sense the presence and location of poisons, poisonous creatures, and diseases within 30 feet of you.

name: Purify Food and Drink
components: V, S
description: All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice becomes purified and rendered free of poison and disease.

name: Fog Cloud
components: V, S
description: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within range; the sphere spreads around corners and the area is heavily obscured.

name: Jump
components: V, S, M (a grasshopper's hind leg)
description: You touch a creature; its jump distance is tripled until the spell ends.

name: Longstrider
components: V, S, M (a pinch of dirt)
description: You touch a creature; the target's speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

name: Expeditious Retreat
components: V, S
description: This spell allows you to move at an incredible pace; you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

name: Barkskin
components: V, S, M (a handful of oak bark)
description: You touch a willing creature; until the spell ends, the target's skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, and the target's AC can't be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor it is wearing.

name: Blindness/Deafness
components: V
description: You can blind or deafen a foe; choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded or deafened for the duration.

name: Enhance Ability
components: V, S, M (fur or a feather from a beast)
description: You touch a creature and bestow a magical enhancement; choose one ability score to grant advantage on related checks and an additional benefit depending on the choice.

name: Gust of Wind
components: V, S, M (a legume seed)
description: A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose; it disperses gas or vapor and can push creatures.

name: Knock
components: V
description: Choose an object that you can see within range; a loud knock, audible from as far away as 300 feet, emanates from the target and it becomes unlocked, unbarred, or unsealed.

name: See Invisibility
components: V, S, M (a pinch of talc and a small sprinkling of powdered silver)
description: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane.

name: Spider Climb
components: V, S, M (a drop of bitumen and a spider)
description: You touch a willing creature; until the spell ends, the creature gains the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings.

name: Clairvoyance
components: V, S, M (a focus worth at least 100 gp, either a jeweled horn for hearing or a glass eye for seeing)
description: You create an invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you; you can hear or see through the sensor.

name: Magic Circle
components: V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron worth at least 100 gp)
description: You create a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-tall cylinder of magical energy that hedges out celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead.

name: Protection from Energy
components: V, S
description: A willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

name: Sleet Storm
components: V, S, M (a pinch of dust and a few drops of water)
description: A 20-foot-tall cylinder of freezing rain and sleet creates difficult terrain, heavily obscures the area, and extinguishes flames.

name: Stinking Cloud
components: V, S, M (a rotten egg or several skunk cabbage leaves)
description: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas; the area is heavily obscured and creatures that fail a Constitution save spend their action retching and reeling.

name: Water Walk
components: V, S, M (a piece of cork)
description: This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface—such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava—as if it were harmless solid ground.

name: Revivify
components: V, S, M (diamonds worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

name: Blade Ward
components: V, S
description: You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air; you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks until the end of your next turn.

name: Dancing Lights
components: V, S, M (a bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm)
description: You create up to four torch-sized lights that hover and move as you direct within range.

name: Animal Friendship
components: V, S, M (a morsel of food)
description: This spell lets you convince a beast that you mean it no harm; on a failed Wisdom save, it is charmed by you for the duration.

name: False Life
components: V, S, M (a small amount of alcohol or distilled spirits)
description: Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain 1d4 + 4 temporary hit points for the duration.

name: Hellish Rebuke
components: V, S
description: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. It must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

name: Speak with Animals
components: V, S
description: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration.

name: Unseen Servant
components: V, S, M (a piece of string and a bit of wood)
description: This spell creates an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs simple tasks at your command.

name: Flame Blade
components: V, S, M (leaf of sumac)
description: You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand; you can make melee spell attacks with it to deal fire damage.

name: Flaming Sphere
components: V, S, M (a bit of tallow, a pinch of brimstone, and a dusting of powdered iron)
description: A 5-foot-diameter sphere of fire appears in an unoccupied space; creatures that end their turn within 5 feet make a Dexterity save or take fire damage. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Gentle Repose
components: V, S, M (a pinch of salt and a copper piece placed on each of the corpse's eyes, which the spell consumes)
description: You touch a corpse or remains; the target is protected from decay and cannot become undead for the duration.

name: Protection from Poison
components: V, S
description: You touch a creature; it neutralizes one poison and grants advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and it has resistance to poison damage for the duration.

name: Silence
components: V, S
description: No sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range.

name: Warding Bond
components: V, S, M (a pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration)
description: This spell wards a willing creature you touch and creates a mystic connection; the target gets +1 bonus to AC and saving throws and resistance to all damage, but each time it takes damage, you take the same amount.

name: Blink
components: V, S
description: Roll a d20 at the end of each of your turns; on 11 or higher, you vanish from your current plane and appear in the Ethereal Plane until the start of your next turn.

name: Call Lightning
components: V, S
description: A storm cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder; on each of your turns, you can call down a bolt of lightning that strikes a point you can see within range. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Fear
components: V, S, M (a white feather or the heart of a hen)
description: Project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears; each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom save or drop what it is holding and become frightened.

name: Gaseous Form
components: V, S, M (a bit of gauze and a wisp of smoke)
description: You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it is wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration.

name: Hypnotic Pattern
components: S, M (a glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material)
description: You create a twisting pattern of colors; each creature in a 30-foot cube who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom save or become charmed and incapacitated with a speed of 0.

name: Tongues
components: V, S, M (a small clay model of a ziggurat)
description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears and makes the target understood by any creature that knows at least one language.

name: Beacon of Hope
components: V, S
description: This spell bestows hope and vitality; choose any number of creatures within range. For the duration, each target has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

name: Bestow Curse
components: V, S
description: Touch a creature; the target must succeed on a Wisdom save or become cursed, suffering an effect of your choice. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 5th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours. When you use a 7th-level spell slot or higher, the duration is until dispelled.

name: Plant Growth
components: V, S
description: This spell channels vitality into plants within a 100-foot radius centered on a point within range, either enriching the land or making vegetation thick and overgrown.

name: Create Food and Water
components: V, S
description: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of water on the ground or in containers within range, enough to sustain up to fifteen humanoids or five steeds for 24 hours.

name: Glyph of Warding
components: V, S, M (incense and powdered diamond worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: When you cast this spell, you inscribe a glyph that harms other creatures, either explosive runes or a spell glyph storing a 3rd-level or lower spell.

name: Mass Healing Word
components: V
description: As you call out words of restoration, up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range regain hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

name: Meld into Stone
components: V, S
description: You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, melding yourself and all the equipment you carry with the stone.

name: Sending
components: V, S, M (a short piece of fine copper wire)
description: You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar; the target hears the message in its mind and can reply in a like manner.

name: Speak with Dead
components: V, S, M (burning incense)
description: You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose.

name: Spirit Guardians
components: V, S, M (a holy symbol)
description: You call forth spirits to protect you; their area moves with you, and affected creatures make a Wisdom save or take radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) and have halved speed while in the area. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Feign Death
components: V, S, M (a pinch of graveyard dirt)
description: You touch a willing creature and put it into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death.

name: Speak with Plants
components: V, S
description: You imbue plants within 30 feet of you with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow simple commands.

name: Wind Wall
components: V, S, M (a tiny fan and a feather of an exotic bird)
areaOfEffect: Wall up to 50 ft long, 15 ft high, 1 ft thick
description: A wall of strong wind rises from the ground; it keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay, and small flying creatures or projectiles are deflected.

name: Leomund's Tiny Hut
components: V, S, M (a small crystal bead)
description: A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you; the atmosphere inside is comfortable and dry regardless of the weather outside.

name: Major Image
components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece)
description: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot cube and includes sound, smell, and temperature. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled.

name: Nondetection
components: V, S, M (a pinch of diamond dust worth 25 gp sprinkled over the target, which the spell consumes)
description: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from divination magic; the target can't be targeted by scrying sensors.

name: Phantom Steed
components: V, S
description: You summon a large, quasi-real, horselike creature. It uses your statistics for checks where relevant, and has a speed of 100 feet.

name: Slow
components: V, S, M (a drop of molasses)
areaOfEffect: Up to 6 creatures in a 40-foot cube
description: You alter time around up to six creatures, reducing their speed, imposing -2 penalty to AC and Dex saves, and limiting reactions and actions on a failed Wisdom save.

name: Vampiric Touch
components: V, S
description: The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force; make a melee spell attack to deal necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half the amount dealt. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Friends
components: S, M (a small amount of makeup applied to the face as this spell is cast)
description: For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at one creature of your choice that isn't hostile toward you. When the spell ends, the creature realizes you used magic to influence its mood and may become hostile at the GM's discretion.

name: Thorn Whip
components: V, S, M (the stem of a plant with thorns)
description: You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns. Make a melee spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, the creature takes piercing damage and, if it is Large or smaller, you can pull it up to 10 feet closer to you.

name: Color Spray
components: V, S, M (a pinch of colored sand, a red feather, or a crystal)
description: A dazzling array of flashing, colored light springs from your hand. Roll 6d10; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect, starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points in the area. Creatures are blinded until the spell ends for them. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d10 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Find Familiar
components: V, S, M (10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier)
description: You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form of your choice. It acts independently of you but always obeys your commands. If it drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving no physical form behind.

name: Tenser's Floating Disk
components: V, S, M (a drop of mercury)
description: You create a circular, horizontal plane of force, 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch thick, that floats 3 feet above the ground and remains for the duration. It can hold up to 500 pounds and follows you at a distance of 20 feet.

name: Heroism
components: V, S
description: A willing creature you touch is imbued with bravery. Until the spell ends, the creature is immune to being frightened and gains temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns.

name: Illusory Script
components: S, M (a lead-based ink worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You write on parchment, paper, or some other suitable writing material and imbue it with a potent illusion that is legible only to creatures you designate. All others see an entirely different message or no writing at all.

name: Inflict Wounds
components: V, S
description: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes necrotic damage. The spell's damage increases when you cast it using higher-level slots. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Silent Image
components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece)
description: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon no larger than a 15-foot cube. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.

name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
components: V, S, M (tiny tarts and a feather that is waved in the air)
description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range perceives everything as hilariously funny and falls into fits of laughter if it fails a Wisdom saving throw, becoming prone and incapacitated for the duration.

name: Witch Bolt
components: V, S, M (a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning)
description: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out toward a creature within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and the target. On a hit, the target takes lightning damage, and on subsequent turns you can use your action to deal more damage automatically. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Ray of Sickness
components: V, S
description: A sickening greenish energy ray lashes out toward a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of your next turn. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Detect Evil and Good
components: V, S
description: For the duration, you know if there is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located.

name: Divine Favor
components: V, S
description: Your prayer empowers your strikes with radiant energy. Until the spell ends, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d4 radiant damage on a hit.

name: Alter Self
components: V, S
description: You assume a different form. Choose aquatic adaptation, change appearance, or natural weapons. The chosen effect lasts for the duration.

name: Animal Messenger
components: V, S, M (a morsel of food)
description: By means of this spell, you use an animal to deliver a message. Choose a Tiny beast you can see within range; it carries your message to a location you describe.

name: Arcane Lock
components: V, S, M (gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You touch a closed door, window, gate, chest, or other entryway, and it becomes locked for the duration. You can set a password or designate creatures that can pass without the lock ending.

name: Calm Emotions
components: V, S
description: You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere must make a Charisma save; you can suppress the charmed or frightened condition, or make indifferent those hostile toward you and your companions.

name: Continual Flame
components: V, S, M (ruby dust worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: A flame, equivalent in brightness to a torch, springs forth from an object that you touch. The effect looks like a regular flame but creates no heat and doesn't use oxygen.

name: Detect Thoughts
components: V, S, M (a copper piece)
description: You can read the thoughts of certain creatures. You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature you choose, and with your action you can probe deeper if it fails a save.

name: Find Traps
components: V, S
description: You sense the presence of any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable.

name: Heat Metal
components: V, S, M (a piece of iron and a flame)
description: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot and harm the creature holding or wearing it. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Locate Object
components: V, S, M (a forked twig)
description: Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object's location, as long as that object is within 1,000 feet of you.

name: Magic Weapon
components: V, S
description: You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, that weapon becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher slot, the bonus increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

name: Moonbeam
components: V, S, M (several seeds of any moonseed plant and a piece of opalescent feldspar)
description: A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. A creature entering the area or starting its turn there takes radiant damage, or half on a successful save. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Pass without Trace
components: V, S, M (ashes from a burned leaf of mistletoe and a sprig of spruce)
description: A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. You gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means.

name: Prayer of Healing
components: V
description: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain hit points. At Higher Levels: The healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Spiritual Weapon
components: V, S
description: You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 3rd-level or higher slot, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

name: Suggestion
components: V, M (a snake's tongue and either a bit of honeycomb or a drop of sweet oil)
description: You suggest a course of activity and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. On a failed save, it pursues the course you described to the best of its ability.

name: Arcane Eye
components: V, S, M (a bit of bat fur)
description: You create an invisible, magical eye within range that you can move and see through. The eye has darkvision and can pass through small openings but not solid barriers.

name: Blight
components: V, S
description: Necromantic energy washes over a creature you can see, draining moisture and vitality. On a failed Constitution save, it takes heavy necrotic damage, or half as much on a success. Plants and plant creatures are affected differently. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

name: Confusion
components: V, S, M (three nutshells)
description: Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose must succeed on a Wisdom save or be affected by erratic behavior, determined at the start of each of its turns.

name: Control Water
components: V, S, M (a drop of water and a pinch of dust)
description: You control water in a 100-foot cube: flood or drain, redirect flow, part water, or create a whirlpool in a body of water.

name: Dimension Door
components: V, S
description: You teleport yourself and up to one willing creature you can carry to any spot within 500 feet that you can visualize or describe by distance and direction.

name: Divination
components: V, S, M (incense and a sacrificial offering appropriate to your religion, worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: Your magic and an offering put you in contact with a god or servant. You ask a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days; you receive a truthful reply that might be a short phrase, cryptic rhyme, or omen.

name: Dominate Beast
components: V, S
description: You attempt to beguile a beast you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom save or be charmed; while charmed, you have control of it. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours. When you use an 8th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 24 hours.

name: Freedom of Movement
components: V, S, M (a leather strap, bound around the arm or a similar appendage)
description: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, difficult terrain doesn’t cost extra movement, and the target can’t be paralyzed, restrained, or impeded by magical effects on its movement.

name: Giant Insect
components: V, S
description: You transform up to ten centipedes, three spiders, five wasps, or one scorpion within range into giant versions for the duration.

name: Greater Invisibility
components: V, S
description: You or a creature you touch becomes invisible for the duration. The target can attack and cast spells without ending the invisibility.

name: Guardian of Faith
components: V
description: A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration, dealing radiant damage to hostile creatures that move to or start their turn in its space. The guardian vanishes after dealing 60 damage.

name: Hallucinatory Terrain
components: V, S, M (a stone, a twig, and a bit of green plant)
description: You make natural terrain in a 150-foot cube look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural terrain. Physical characteristics don't change but the illusion can fool the senses.

name: Ice Storm
components: V, S, M (a pinch of dust and a few drops of water)
description: A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range, dealing bludgeoning and cold damage; the area becomes difficult terrain until the end of your next turn. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

name: Locate Creature
components: V, S, M (a bit of fur from a bloodhound)
description: Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creature’s location, as long as that creature is within 1,000 feet and not blocked by running water.

name: Phantasmal Killer
components: V, S
description: You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see; it must succeed on a Wisdom save or become frightened for the duration and take psychic damage on subsequent failed saves.

name: Polymorph
components: V, S, M (a caterpillar cocoon)
description: This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling target must make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the transformation.

name: Stone Shape
components: V, S, M (soft clay, which must be worked into roughly the desired shape of the stone object)
description: You touch a stone object or a section of stone that fits within a 5-foot cube and form it into any shape that suits your purpose.

name: Stoneskin
components: V, S, M (diamond dust worth 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You touch a willing creature and turn its skin as hard as stone. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

name: Wall of Fire
components: V, S, M (a small piece of phosphorus)
areaOfEffect: Wall up to 60 ft long, 20 ft high, 1 ft thick or ring 20 ft diameter
description: You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. One side of the wall deals fire damage when a creature ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

name: Death Ward
components: V, S
description: You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points, it instead drops to 1, and other effects that would kill it outright are negated once.

name: Fabricate
components: V, S
description: You convert raw materials within range into a product of the same material. You can fabricate a Large or smaller object (smaller for stone or metal).

name: Fire Shield
components: V, S, M (a bit of phosphorus or a firefly)
description: Thin and wispy flames wreathe your body, shedding bright light. You choose warm or chill shield: you gain resistance to cold or fire, and when a creature hits you with a melee attack, it takes fire or cold damage.

name: Antilife Shell
components: V, S, M (a small amount of olive oil)
description: A barrier extends out from you to a radius of 10 feet, preventing creatures other than undead and constructs from entering the area for the duration.

name: Cone of Cold
components: V, S, M (a small crystal or glass cone)
description: A blast of cold air erupts from your hands; creatures in a 60-foot cone make a Constitution save, taking cold damage on a fail or half on success. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Conjure Elemental
components: V, S, M (burning incense and an appropriate vessel)
description: You call forth an elemental of challenge rating 5 or lower that appears in an unoccupied space; it is friendly to you and acts on your turns. It obeys your commands while you concentrate. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Dominate Person
components: V, S
description: You attempt to beguile a humanoid you can see within range; on a failed Wisdom save, it is charmed and you have control over it for the duration. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.

name: Hold Monster
components: V, S, M (a small, straight piece of iron)
description: Choose a creature you can see; it must succeed on a Wisdom save or be paralyzed for the duration. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

name: Telekinesis
components: V, S
description: You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought; each round, you can move a creature or object within range with a contest or check as appropriate.

name: Wall of Force
components: V, S, M (a pinch of powder made by crushing a clear gemstone)
description: An invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall is immune to damage and can't be dispelled by dispel magic.

name: Wall of Stone
components: V, S, M (a small block of granite)
description: A nonmagical wall of solid stone springs into existence; you can shape it as you like. The wall can become permanent if concentration is maintained for the full duration.

name: Flame Strike
components: V, S, M (pinch of sulfur)
description: A vertical column of divine fire roars down from the heavens; creatures in the area make a Dexterity save, taking fire and radiant damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (your choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Greater Restoration
components: V, S, M (diamond dust worth 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect: one level of exhaustion, one charm or petrification effect, a curse (including attunement to a cursed item), or one reduction to an ability score or hit point maximum.

name: Mass Cure Wounds
components: V, S
description: A wave of healing energy washes out; choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere. Each target regains hit points (higher when cast with higher-level slots). At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Geas
components: V
description: You place a magical command on a creature that you can see within range, forcing it to carry out some service or refrain from an action as you decide for the duration. The target takes psychic damage if it disobeys. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the duration is 1 year. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the spell lasts until ended by remove curse, greater restoration, or wish.

name: Planar Binding
components: V, S, M (a jewel worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: With this spell, you attempt to bind a celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend to your service. The creature must be within range for the entire casting. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of a higher level, the duration increases to 10 days with a 6th-level slot, to 30 days with a 7th-level slot, to 180 days with an 8th-level slot, and to a year and a day with a 9th-level spell slot.

name: Teleportation Circle
components: V, M (rare chalks and inks infused with precious gems worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: As you cast the spell, you draw a 10-foot-diameter circle on the ground inscribed with sigils. The circle links to a permanent teleportation circle you know; creatures entering the circle are instantly transported.

name: Arcane Hand
components: V, S, M (an eggshell and a snakeskin glove)
description: A Large spectral hand appears at a point you choose. The hand moves at your command and can shove, interpose, grasp, or strike (Bigby's Hand). At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage from the clenched fist option increases by 2d8 and the damage from the grasping hand increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Animate Objects
components: V, S
description: You animate up to ten nonmagical objects within range. Each object acts as a creature under your control while you concentrate. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 5th.

name: Awaken
components: V, S, M (an agate worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways, you awaken the target beast or plant to intelligence and awareness.

name: Cloudkill
components: V, S
description: You create a moving, poisonous fog. The cloud spreads around corners, heavily obscures the area, and can move away from you; creatures in it take poison damage. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Commune
components: V, S, M (incense and a vial of holy or unholy water)
description: You contact your deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three yes-or-no questions that are answered truthfully.

name: Commune with Nature
components: V, S
description: You briefly become one with nature and learn about the surrounding territory: terrain, bodies of water, plants, minerals, peoples, and powerful creatures.

name: Contact Other Plane
components: V
description: You mentally contact a demigod, the spirit of a long-dead sage, or other mysterious entity from another plane; incorrect handling can leave you mentally strained.

name: Contagion
components: V, S
description: Your touch inflicts disease. On a failed save over time, the target suffers the effects of a virulent sickness until cured.

name: Creation
components: V, S, M (a tiny piece of the material of the created object)
description: You pull wisps of shadow-stuff to create a nonliving object of vegetable matter or other material that lasts for a limited time. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the cube increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

name: Dispel Evil and Good
components: V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron)
description: Shimmering energy surrounds you, protecting from aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead, and enabling you to break enchantments.

name: Dream
components: V, S, M (a handful of sand)
description: You shape the dreams of a target; you or a messenger appears in the target's dream and can deliver a message or torment the target.

name: Hallow
components: V, S, M (herbs, oils, and incense worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You infuse an area with holy (or unholy) power, binding extra effects to it and warding against certain creature types and effects.

name: Insect Plague
components: V, S, M (a few grains of sugar, some kernels of grain, and a smear of fat)
description: Swarming biting locusts fill a 20-foot-radius sphere, heavily obscuring the area and dealing piercing damage to creatures within. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Legend Lore
components: V, S, M (incense worth 250 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: Name or describe a person, place, or object; you learn significant lore about it, which might be forgotten stories, secret lore, or even recent tales.

name: Mislead
components: S
description: You become invisible while a perfect illusion of you appears and acts independently as you direct.

name: Modify Memory
components: V, S
description: You reshape the target's memories of an event within the last 24 hours (more with higher slots) on a failed Wisdom save. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can alter the target's memories of an event that took place up to 7 days ago (6th level), 30 days ago (7th level), 1 year ago (8th level), or any time in the creature's past (9th level).

name: Passwall
components: V, S, M (sesame seeds)
description: A passage appears at a point you choose on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface within range, creating a tunnel you can move through.

name: Raise Dead
components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You return a dead creature you touch to life, provided it has been dead no longer than 10 days, with penalties that lessen over time.

name: Reincarnate
components: V, S, M (oils and unguents worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You touch a dead humanoid and form a new adult body for it; the creature returns to life with the same personality and memories but a new body.

name: Scrying
components: V, S, M (a focus worth at least 1,000 gp)
description: You create an invisible sensor within range on a creature or place you choose; you can see and hear through the sensor.

name: Seeming
components: V, S
description: You change the appearance of any number of creatures you can see within range; the spell disguises physical appearance and clothing.

name: Tree Stride
components: V, S
description: You gain the ability to step from one tree to another of the same kind within range, expending movement to teleport between trunks.

name: Rary's Telepathic Bond
components: V, S, M (two eggshell halves from two different kinds of creatures)
description: You forge a telepathic link among up to eight willing creatures of your choice, each of which is within range, allowing private communication for the duration.

name: Arcane Gate
components: V, S
description: You create two linked portals that remain open for the duration; creatures can move instantly between them as if stepping through a doorway.

name: Blade Barrier
components: V, S
areaOfEffect: Wall up to 100 ft long, 20 ft high, 5 ft thick
description: You create a wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades. A creature that enters the wall for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes slashing damage unless it succeeds on a Dexterity save to take half as much.

name: Chain Lightning
components: V, S, M (a bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass)
description: A bolt of lightning arcs toward a target you choose and then leaps to up to three other targets within 30 feet of it; each target makes a Dexterity save, taking lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. At Higher Levels: You can choose one additional secondary target for each slot level above 6th.

name: Disintegrate
components: V, S, M (a lodestone and a pinch of dust)
description: A thin green ray springs from your finger toward a target; on a failed Dexterity save, the target takes massive force damage and is disintegrated if reduced to 0 hit points. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 3d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Heal
components: V, S
description: A surge of positive energy washes through a creature you can see within range; the target regains a large number of hit points and the spell ends blindness and deafness and cures diseases affecting the target. At Higher Levels: The amount healed increases by 10 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Mass Suggestion
components: V, M (a snake's tongue and either a bit of honeycomb or a drop of sweet oil)
description: You suggest a course of activity that can influence up to twelve creatures that can hear and understand you. On a failed Wisdom save, each target follows the suggested course to the best of its ability. At Higher Levels: With a 7th-level slot, the duration becomes 10 days; with an 8th-level slot, 30 days; and with a 9th-level slot, 1 year and 1 day.

name: Sunbeam
components: V, S, M (a magnifying glass)
description: A beam of brilliant light flashes from your hand in a 60-foot line; each creature in the line makes a Constitution save, taking radiant damage and possibly becoming blinded on a failed save, or half as much on a success. You can create a new line as an action on each of your turns for the duration.

name: True Seeing
components: V, S, M (an ointment for the eyes that costs 25 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: This spell grants the willing creature you touch the ability to see things as they actually are, including secret doors hidden by magic, invisible creatures and objects, and into the Ethereal Plane.

name: Wall of Ice
components: V, S, M (a small piece of quartz)
areaOfEffect: Wall up to 100 ft long, 20 ft high, 1 ft thick or hemisphere with 20 ft radius
description: You create a wall of ice on a solid surface. When it appears, creatures in its area make a Dexterity save, taking cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a success; the wall is an object with hit points that can be damaged and broken.

name: Globe of Invulnerability
components: V, S, M (a small, delicate glass bead)
description: An immobile, faintly shimmering barrier springs into existence in a 10-foot radius around you and remains for the duration. The barrier prevents spells of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier from affecting creatures and objects within. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a higher-level slot, the barrier stops spells of that slot level and lower.

name: Circle of Death
components: V, S, M (the powder of a crushed black pearl worth at least 500 gp)
description: A sphere of negative energy ripples out in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose. Each creature in that area makes a Constitution saving throw, taking necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Create Undead
components: V, S, M (a black onyx gem worth at least 150 gp for each corpse)
description: You raise up to three Medium or Small humanoid corpses as ghouls under your control. The undead remain under your control for 24 hours; to maintain control, you must cast this spell again before the 24 hours end. At Higher Levels: With a 7th-level slot, you can create or reassert control over six ghouls or two ghasts; with an 8th-level slot, twelve ghouls, or four ghasts, or two wights; with a 9th-level slot, twenty-four ghouls, or eight ghasts, or four wights, or two mummies.

name: Eyebite
components: V, S
description: Your eyes become an inky void imbued with dread power. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can target one creature you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer one of the following effects of your choice: Asleep, Panicked, or Sickened. The effect ends on a successful save at the end of each of its turns.

name: Flesh to Stone
components: V, S, M (a pinch of lime, water, and earth)
description: You attempt to turn a creature you can see within range into stone. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or be restrained as its flesh begins to harden. A restrained target must make another Constitution save at the end of each of its turns; on a success, the effect ends, on a failure, the creature is petrified until the effect is removed.

name: Guards and Wards
components: V, S, M (burning incense, a small amount of gum arabic, and a silver thread)
description: You create a ward that protects up to a 50,000-cubic-foot area within a building. You can layer several magical effects such as fog, arcane locks, web-filled stairs, confusing patterns, and more. Dispel magic can end individual effects.

name: Harm
components: V, S
description: You unleash a virulent disease on a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking heavy necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The damage can’t reduce the target’s hit points below 1. On a failed save, the target’s hit point maximum is also reduced by the amount of damage taken until the target finishes a long rest.

name: Heroes' Feast
components: V, S, M (a gem-encrusted bowl worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You bring forth a great feast, including magnificent food and drink. Up to twelve creatures can partake over 1 hour and gain several benefits for 24 hours, including cured disease and poison, immunity to poison and being frightened, advantage on Wisdom saves, and increased hit point maximum (gaining 2d10 temporary hit points).

name: Magic Jar
components: V, S, M (a gem, crystal, reliquary, or some other ornamental container worth at least 500 gp)
description: Your body falls into a catatonic state as your soul leaves it and enters the container used for the spell’s material component. While in the container, you can attempt to possess a humanoid within 100 feet; the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be possessed as described. If the host body drops to 0 hit points, you return to the container if within range, otherwise you return to your original body if it is within range, or die if neither is available.

name: Move Earth
components: V, S, M (an iron blade and a small bag containing a mixture of soils—clay, loam, and sand)
description: Choose an area of terrain you can see that is no larger than 40 feet on a side. You can reshape dirt, sand, or clay in the area in any manner you choose for the duration, raising or lowering the area’s elevation, creating trenches, ditches, berms, or similar features. You can’t push creatures through the earth.

name: Programmed Illusion
components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece and jade dust worth at least 25 gp)
description: You create an illusion of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon no larger than a 30-foot cube that activates when a specific condition occurs. The illusion can include sound, smell, and temperature. You can set the triggering condition and behaviors.

name: Wall of Thorns
components: V, S, M (a handful of thorns)
areaOfEffect: Wall up to 60 ft long, 10 ft high, 5 ft thick or a ringed wall up to 20 ft diameter, 20 ft high, 5 ft thick
description: A wall of tough, pliable, tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns appears. A creature moving through the wall takes piercing damage for every foot moved and must make a Dexterity saving throw when the wall appears or enter it; on a failed save it takes additional damage, or half as much on a success. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 7th-level spell slot, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Wind Walk
components: V, S, M (fire and holy water)
description: You and up to ten willing creatures you can see within range assume gaseous forms for the duration. While in cloud form, a creature has a flying speed of 300 feet and has resistance to nonmagical damage, among other limitations described by the spell. It takes 1 minute to assume or return from cloud form.
